servers.description: Your Unleash instance (replace with your actual URL)

apiKey.name: Authorization
apiKey.description: API key needed to access this API

bearerToken.description: API key needed to access this API, in Bearer token format

addonCreateUpdateSchema.description: Data required to create or update an [Unleash addon](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate) instance.

provider.description:
The addon provider, such as "webhook" or "slack". This string is **case sensitive** and maps to the provider's `name` property.

The list of all supported providers and their parameters for a specific Unleash instance can be found by making a GET request to the `api/admin/addons` endpoint: the `providers` property of that response will contain all available providers.

The default set of providers can be found in the [addons reference documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate). The default supported options are:
- `datadog` for [Datadog](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate/datadog)
- `slack` for [Slack](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate/slack)
- `teams` for [Microsoft Teams](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate/teams)
- `webhook` for [webhooks](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate/webhook)

The provider you choose for your addon dictates what properties the `parameters` object needs. Refer to the documentation for each provider for more information.

description.description: A description of the addon.
description.example: This addon posts updates to our internal feature tracking system whenever a feature is created or updated.

enabled.description: Whether the addon should be enabled or not.

parameters.description: Parameters for the addon provider. This object has different required and optional properties depending on the provider you choose. Consult the documentation for details.

events.description: The event types that will trigger this specific addon.

projects.description: The projects that this addon will listen to events from. An empty list means it will listen to events from **all** projects.

environments.description: The list of environments that this addon will listen to events from. An empty list means it will listen to events from **all** environments.

name.description: The name of the parameter as it is used in code. References to this parameter should use this value.

displayName.description: The name of the parameter as it is shown to the end user in the Admin UI.

type.description: The type of the parameter. Corresponds roughly to [HTML `input` field types](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Input#input_types). Multi-line inut fields are indicated as `textfield` (equivalent to the HTML `textarea` tag).

description.example: The emoji_icon to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to ":unleash:".
description.description: A description of the parameter. This should explain to the end user what the parameter is used for.

placeholder.description: The default value for this parameter. This value is used if no other value is provided.

required.description: Whether this parameter is required or not. If a parameter is required, you must give it a value when you create the addon. If it is not required it can be left out. It may receive a default value in those cases.

sensitive.description: Indicates whether this parameter is **sensitive** or not. Unleash will not return sensitive parameters to API requests. It will instead use a number of asterisks to indicate that a value is set, e.g. "******". The number of asterisks does not correlate to the parameter's value.

addonSchema.description: An [addon](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate) instance description. Contains data about what kind of provider it uses, whether it's enabled or not, what events it listens for, and more.

id.description: The addon's unique identifier.

provider.description: The addon provider, such as "webhook" or "slack".

description.description: A description of the addon. `null` if no description exists.
description.example: This addon posts updates to our internal feature tracking system whenever a feature is created or updated.

enabled.description: Whether the addon is enabled or not.

parameters.description: Parameters for the addon provider. This object has different required and optional properties depending on the provider you choose.

events.description: The event types that trigger this specific addon.

projects.description: The projects that this addon listens to events from. An empty list means it listens to events from **all** projects.

environments.description: The list of environments that this addon listens to events from. An empty list means it listens to events from **all** environments.

addonTypeSchema.description: An addon provider. Defines a specific addon type and what the end user must configure when creating a new addon of that type.

name.description: The name of the addon type. When creating new addons, this goes in the payload's `type` field.

displayName.description: The addon type's name as it should be displayed in the admin UI.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to where you can find more information about using this addon type.

description.description: A description of the addon type.
description.example: Allows Unleash to post updates to Slack.

howTo.description: A long description of how to use this addon type. This will be displayed on the top of configuration page. Can contain markdown.
howTo.example:
This is **how you use** this addon type...
  - Step 1
  - Step 2
  - Step 3

tagTypes.description: A list of [Unleash tag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/feature-flags#tags) that this addon uses. These tags will be added to the Unleash instance when an addon of this type is created.

example.name: slack
example.description: Slack tag used by the slack-addon to specify the slack channel.

parameters.description: The addon provider's parameters. Use these to configure an addon of this provider type. Items with `required: true` must be provided.

example.name: url
example.description: (Required)

example.name: username
example.description: The username to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to "Unleash".

example.name: emojiIcon
example.description: The emoji_icon to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to ":unleash:".

example.name: defaultChannel
example.description: (Required) Default channel to post updates to if not specified in the slack-tag

events.description: All the [event types](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/events#event-types) that are available for this addon provider.

installation.description: The installation configuration for this addon type.

url.description: A URL to where the addon configuration should redirect to install addons of this type.

title.description: The title of the installation configuration. This will be displayed to the user when installing addons of this type.

helpText.description: The help text of the installation configuration. This will be displayed to the user when installing addons of this type.
helpText.example: Clicking the Install button will send you to Slack to initiate the installation procedure for the Unleash App for Slack for your workspace

alerts.description: A list of alerts to display to the user when installing addons of this type.

type.description: The type of alert. This determines the color of the alert.

text.description: The text of the alert. This is what will be displayed to the user.
text.example: Please ensure you have the Unleash App for Slack installed in your Slack workspace if you haven't installed it already. If you want the Unleash App for Slack bot to post messages to private channels, you'll need to invite it to those channels.

deprecated.description: This should be used to inform the user that this addon type is deprecated and should not be used. Deprecated addons will show a badge with this information on the UI.
deprecated.example: This integration is deprecated. Please try the new integration instead.

addonsSchema.description:
An object containing two things:
1. A list of all [addons](https://docs.getunleash.io/integrate) defined on this Unleash instance
2. A list of all addon providers defined on this instance

addons.description: All the addons that exist on this instance of Unleash.

providers.description: A list of  all available addon providers, along with their parameters and descriptions.

example.name: webhook
example.description: A Webhook is a generic way to post messages from Unleash to third party services.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: (Required) Unleash will perform a HTTP Post to the specified URL (one retry if first attempt fails)

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: (Optional) The Content-Type header to use. Defaults to "application/json".

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: (Optional) The Authorization header to use. Not used if left blank.

parameters.name: bodyTemplate
parameters.description: (Optional) You may format the body using a mustache template. If you don't specify anything, the format will similar to the events format (https://docs.getunleash.io/api/events)

example.name: slack
example.description: Allows Unleash to post updates to Slack.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: (Required)

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to "Unleash".

parameters.name: emojiIcon
parameters.description: The emoji_icon to use when posting messages to slack. Defaults to ":unleash:".

parameters.name: defaultChannel
parameters.description: (Required) Default channel to post updates to if not specified in the slack-tag

tagTypes.name: slack
tagTypes.description: Slack tag used by the slack-addon to specify the slack channel.

example.name: teams
example.description: Allows Unleash to post updates to Microsoft Teams.

parameters.description: (Required)

example.name: datadog
example.description: Allows Unleash to post updates to Datadog.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Default URL: https://api.datadoghq.com/api/v1/events. Needs to be changed if your're not using the US1 site.

parameters.name: apiKey

tagTypes.name: datadog
tagTypes.description: All Datadog tags added to a specific feature are sent to datadog event stream.

adminCountSchema.description: Contains total admin counts for an Unleash instance.

password.description: Total number of admins that have a password set.

noPassword.description: Total number of admins that do not have a password set. May be SSO, but may also be users that did not set a password yet.

service.description: Total number of service accounts that have the admin root role.

adminFeaturesQuerySchema.description: Query parameters used to modify the list of features returned.

tag.description: Used to filter by tags. For each entry, a TAGTYPE:TAGVALUE is expected

namePrefix.description: A case-insensitive prefix filter for the names of feature flags

id.description: The ID of this segment

description.description: The description for this segment
description.example: IOS users segment

constraints.description: The list of constraints that are used in this segment

usedInFeatures.description: The number of feature flags that use this segment. The number also includes the any flags with pending change requests that would add this segment.

usedInProjects.description: The number of projects that use this segment. The number includes any projects with pending change requests that would add this segment.

project.description: The project the segment belongs to. Only present if the segment is a project-specific segment.

createdBy.description: The creator's email or username

createdAt.description: When the segment was created

advancedPlaygroundEnvironmentFeatureSche.description: A simplified feature flag model intended for the Unleash playground.

environment.description: The feature's environment.

context.description: The context to use when evaluating flags

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

strategies.description: Feature's applicable strategies and cumulative results of the strategies

result.description:
The cumulative results of all the feature's strategies. Can be `true`,
                                  `false`, or `unknown`.
                                  This property will only be `unknown`
                                  if one or more of the strategies can't be fully evaluated and the rest of the strategies
                                  all resolve to `false`.

data.description: The strategies that apply to this feature.

isEnabledInCurrentEnvironment.description: Whether the feature is active and would be evaluated in the provided environment in a normal SDK context.

isEnabled.description:
Whether this feature is enabled or not in the current environment.
                          If a feature can't be fully evaluated (that is, `strategies.result` is `unknown`),
                          this will be `false` to align with how client SDKs treat unresolved feature states.

variant.description:
The feature variant you receive based on the provided context or the _disabled
                          variant_. If a feature is disabled or doesn't have any
                          variants, you would get the _disabled variant_.
                          Otherwise, you'll get one of the feature's defined variants.

name.description: The variant's name. If there is no variant or if the flag is disabled, this will be `disabled`

enabled.description: Whether the variant is enabled or not. If the feature is disabled or if it doesn't have variants, this property will be `false`

payload.description: An optional payload attached to the variant.

type.description: The format of the payload.

feature_enabled.description: Whether the feature is enabled or not. If the feature is disabled, this property will be `false`

variants.description: The feature variants.

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

A list of applications this app registration has been registered through. If connected directly to Unleash, this is an empty list. 
 This can be used in later visualizations to tell how many levels of proxy or Edge instances our SDKs have connected through

appName.description: An identifier for the app that uses the sdk, should be static across SDK restarts

instanceId.description: A unique identifier identifying the instance of the application running the SDK. Often changes based on execution environment. For instance: two pods in Kubernetes will have two different instanceIds

environment.description: The SDK's configured 'environment' property. This property was deprecated in v5. This property  does **not** control which Unleash environment the SDK gets toggles for. To control Unleash environments, use the SDKs API key.

platformName.description: The platform the application is running on. For languages that compile to binaries, this can be omitted

platformVersion.description: The version of the platform the application is running on. Languages that compile to binaries, this is expected to be the compiler version used to assemble the binary.

yggdrasilVersion.description: The semantic version of the Yggdrasil engine used by the client. If the client is using a native engine this can be omitted.

specVersion.description: The version of the Unleash client specification the client supports

interval.description: How often (in seconds) does the client refresh its toggles

started.description: Either an RFC-3339 timestamp or a unix timestamp in seconds

strategies.description: Which strategies the SDKs runtime knows about

clientFeatureSchema.description: Feature flag configuration used by SDKs to evaluate state of a flag

name.description: The unique name of a feature flag. Is validated to be URL safe on creation

type.description: What kind of feature flag is this. Refer to the documentation on [feature flag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/feature-flags#feature-flag-types) for more information

description.description: A description of the flag
description.example: No variants here

enabled.description: Whether the feature flag is enabled for the current API key or not. This is ANDed with the evaluation results of the strategies list, so if this is false, the evaluation result will always be false

stale.description: If this is true Unleash believes this feature flag has been active longer than Unleash expects a flag of this type to be active

impressionData.description: Set to true if SDKs should trigger [impression events](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/impression-data) when this flag is evaluated

project.description: Which project this feature flag belongs to

strategies.description: Evaluation strategies for this flag. Each entry in this list will be evaluated and ORed together

variants.description: [Variants](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/feature-flag-variants#what-are-variants) configured for this flag

clientFeaturesDeltaSchema.description: Schema for delta updates of feature configurations.

clientFeaturesQuerySchema.description: Query parameters active for a client features request

tag.description: Features tagged with one of these tags are included

project.description: Features that are part of these projects are included in this response. This is now handled by API tokens and was marked as deprecated in v5

namePrefix.description: Features are filtered to only include features whose name starts with this prefix

environment.description: Strategies for the feature flag configured for this environment are included. This is now handled by API tokens and was marked as deprecated in v5

inlineSegmentConstraints.description: Set to true if requesting client does not support Unleash-Client-Specification 4.2.2 or newer. Modern SDKs will have this set to false, since they will be able to merge constraints and segments themselves

clientFeaturesSchema.description: Configuration data for backend SDKs for evaluating feature flags.

version.description: A version number for the format used in the response. Most Unleash instances now return version 2, which includes segments as a separate array

features.description: A list of feature flags with their configuration

segments.description: A list of [Segments](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/segments) configured for this Unleash instance

query.description: A summary of filters and parameters sent to the endpoint. Used by the server to build the features and segments response

clientMetricsEnvSchema.description: Used for reporting feature evaluation results from SDKs

featureName.description: Name of the feature checked by the SDK

appName.description: The name of the application the SDK is being used in

environment.description: Which environment the SDK is being used in

timestamp.description: The start of the time window these metrics are valid for. The window is 1 hour wide

yes.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to true

no.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to false

variants.description: How many times each variant was returned

clientMetricsSchema.description: Client usage metrics, accumulated in buckets of hour by hour by default

appName.description: The name of the application that is evaluating toggles

environment.description: Which environment the application is running in. This property was deprecated in v5. This can be determined by the API key calling this endpoint.

sdkVersion.description: An SDK version identifier. Usually formatted as "unleash-client-<language>:<version>"

platformName.description: The platform the application is running on. For languages that compile to binaries, this can be omitted

platformVersion.description: The version of the platform the application is running on. Languages that compile to binaries, this is expected to be the compiler version used to assemble the binary.

yggdrasilVersion.description: The semantic version of the Yggdrasil engine used by the client. If the client is using a native engine this can be omitted.

specVersion.description: The version of the Unleash client specification the client supports

bucket.description: Holds all metrics gathered over a window of time. Typically 1 hour wide

start.description: The start of the time window these metrics are valid for. The window is usually 1 hour wide

stop.description: The end of the time window these metrics are valid for. The window is 1 hour wide

toggles.description: an object containing feature names with yes/no plus variant usage

yes.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to true

no.description: How many times the toggle evaluated to false

variants.description: An object describing how many times each variant was returned. Variant names are used as properties, and the number of times they were exposed is the corresponding value (i.e. `{ [variantName]: number }`).

clientSegmentSchema.description: Represents a client API segment of users defined by a set of constraints.

id.description: The segment's id.

constraints.description: List of constraints that determine which users are part of the segment

cloneFeatureSchema.description: Copy of a feature with a new name

name.description: The name of the new feature

replaceGroupId.description: Whether to use the new feature name as its group ID or not. Group ID is used for calculating [stickiness](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/stickiness#calculation). Defaults to true.

constraintSchema.description: A strategy constraint. For more information, refer to [the strategy constraint reference documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/activation-strategies#constraints)

contextName.description: The name of the context field that this constraint should apply to.

operator.description: The operator to use when evaluating this constraint. For more information about the various operators, refer to [the strategy constraint operator documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/activation-strategies#constraint-operators).

caseInsensitive.description: Whether the operator should be case sensitive or not. Defaults to `false` (being case sensitive).

inverted.description: Whether the result should be negated or not. If `true`, will turn a `true` result into a `false` result and vice versa.

values.description: The context values that should be used for constraint evaluation. Use this property instead of `value` for properties that accept multiple values.

value.description: The context value that should be used for constraint evaluation. Use this property instead of `values` for properties that only accept single values.

createdAt.description: When this context field was created

usedInFeatures.description: Number of projects where this context field is used in

usedInProjects.description: Number of projects where this context field is used in

legalValues.description: Allowed values for this context field schema. Can be used to narrow down accepted input

project.description: The project this context field belongs to (if it is project-specific)

contextFieldStrategiesSchema.description: A wrapper object containing all strategies that use a specific context field

strategies.description: List of strategies using the context field

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

createApiTokenSchema.description: The data required to create an [Unleash API token](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/api-tokens-and-client-keys).

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: A client or frontend token. Must be one of the strings "client" (deprecated), "backend" (preferred over "client") or "frontend" (not case sensitive).

environment.description: The environment that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "default"

project.description: The project that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "*" meaning every project. This property is mutually incompatible with the `projects` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

projects.description: A list of projects that the token should be valid for. This property is mutually incompatible with the `project` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

createApplicationSchema.description: Reported application information from Unleash SDKs

strategies.description: Which [strategies](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts#activation-strategies) the application has loaded. Useful when trying to figure out if your [custom strategy](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/activation-strategies#custom-strategies) has been loaded in the SDK

color.description: Css color to be used to color the application's entry in the application list

icon.description: An URL to an icon file to be used for the applications's entry in the application list

description.description: A description of the context field
description.example: The user's subscription tier

stickiness.description: `true` if this field should be available for use with [custom stickiness](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/stickiness#custom-stickiness), otherwise `false`

sortOrder.description: How this context field should be sorted if no other sort order is selected

legalValues.description: A list of allowed values for this context field

project.description: The project this context field belongs to (if it is project-specific)

name.description: The name of the context field.

createDependentFeatureSchema.description: Feature dependency on a parent feature in write model

feature.description: The name of the feature we depend on.

enabled.description: Whether the parent feature should be enabled. When `false` variants are ignored. `true` by default.

variants.description: The list of variants the parent feature should resolve to. Leave empty when you only want to check the `enabled` status.

pattern.description: A JavaScript regular expression pattern, without the start and end delimiters. Optional flags are not allowed.

example.description: An example of a feature name that matches the pattern. Must itself match the pattern supplied.

description.description: A description of the pattern in a human-readable format. Will be shown to users when they create a new feature flag.
description.example:
<project>.<featureName>.<ticket>

The flag name should contain the project name, the feature name, and the ticket number, each separated by a dot.

playgroundFeatureSchema.description: A simplified feature flag model intended for the Unleash playground.

projectId.description: The ID of the project that contains this feature.

strategies.description: The feature's applicable strategies and cumulative results of the strategies

result.description:
The cumulative results of all the feature's strategies. Can be `true`,
                                  `false`, or `unknown`.
                                  This property will only be `unknown`
                                  if one or more of the strategies can't be fully evaluated and the rest of the strategies
                                  all resolve to `false`.

data.description: The strategies that apply to this feature.

hasUnsatisfiedDependency.description: Whether the feature has a parent dependency that is not satisfied

isEnabledInCurrentEnvironment.description: Whether the feature is active and would be evaluated in the provided environment in a normal SDK context.

isEnabled.description:
Whether this feature is enabled or not in the current environment.
                          If a feature can't be fully evaluated (that is, `strategies.result` is `unknown`),
                          this will be `false` to align with how client SDKs treat unresolved feature states.

variant.description:
The feature variant you receive based on the provided context or the _disabled
                          variant_. If a feature is disabled or doesn't have any
                          variants, you would get the _disabled variant_.
                          Otherwise, you'll get one of thefeature's defined variants.

name.description: The variant's name. If there is no variant or if the flag is disabled, this will be `disabled`

enabled.description: Whether the variant is enabled or not. If the feature is disabled or if it doesn't have variants, this property will be `false`

payload.description: An optional payload attached to the variant.

type.description: The format of the payload.

enabled.description: Whether this strategy resolves to `false` or if it might resolve to `true`. Because Unleash can't evaluate the strategy, it can't say for certain whether it will be `true`, but if you have failing constraints or segments, it _can_ determine that your strategy would be `false`.

projectStatsSchema.description:
Statistics for a project, including the average time to production, number of features created, the project activity and more.

Stats are divided into current and previous **windows**.
- The **current window** is the past 30 days.
- The **previous window** is the 30 days **before** the current window (from 60 to 30 days ago)

total.description: The number of actionable change requests in the project.

id.description: The identifier for this permission

displayName.description: The name to display in listings of permissions

type.description: What level this permission applies to. Either root, project or the name of the environment it applies to

environment.description: Which environment this permission applies to

adminPermissionsSchema.description: What kind of permissions are available

permissions.description: Returns permissions available at all three levels (root|project|environment)

root.description: Permissions available at the root level, i.e. not connected to any specific project or environment

project.description: Permissions available at the project level

environments.description: A list of environments with available permissions per environment

version.description: The api version of this response. A natural increasing number. Only increases if format changes

changeProjectSchema.description: Data required to move a feature flag to a project.

newProjectId.description: The project to move the feature flag to.

cloneEnvironmentSchema.description: Data used to clone an environment.

name.description: The name of the new cloned environment, this cannot be changed later

type.description: Updates the type of environment (i.e. development or production).

projects.description: A list of projects that should be included in the cloned environment.

clonePermissions.description: Copies the RBAC permissions from the source environment if true. Defaults to true

createEnvironmentSchema.description: Data required to create a new [environment](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/environments)

name.description: The name of the environment. Must be a URL-friendly string according to [RFC 3968, section 2.3](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-2.3)

type.description:
The [type of environment](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/environments#environment-types) you would like to create. Unleash officially recognizes the following values:
- `development`
- `test`
- `preproduction`
- `production`

If you pass a string that is not one of the recognized values, Unleash will accept it, but it will carry no special semantics.

enabled.description: Newly created environments are enabled by default. Set this property to `false` to create the environment in a disabled state.

sortOrder.description: Defines where in the list of environments to place this environment. The list uses an ascending sort, so lower numbers are shown first. You can change this value later.

requiredApprovals.description: Experimental field. The number of approvals required before a change request can be applied in this environment.

createProjectSchema.description: Data used to create a new [project](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/projects).

id.description: The project's identifier. If this property is not present or is an empty string, Unleash will generate the project id automatically. This property is deprecated.

name.description: The project's name. The name must contain at least one non-whitespace character.

description.description: The project's description.
description.example: This project contains features related to the new pet shop.

mode.description: A mode of the project affecting what actions are possible in this project

defaultStickiness.description: A default stickiness for the project affecting the default stickiness value for variants and Gradual Rollout strategy

environments.description: A list of environments that should be enabled for this project. If this property is missing, Unleash will default to enabling all non-deprecated environments for the project. An empty list will result in no environment enabled for the project.

changeRequestEnvironments.description: A list of environments that should have change requests enabled. If the list includes environments not in the `environments` list, they will still have change requests enabled.

name.description: The name of the environment to configure change requests for.

requiredApprovals.description: The number of approvals required for a change request to be fully approved and ready to applied in this environment. If no value is provided, it will be set to the default number, which is 1. Values will be clamped to between 1 and 10 inclusive.

createRoleWithPermissionsSchema.description: A write model for the custom role and permissions to allow Unleash to decide what actions a role holder is allowed to perform

name.description: The name of the custom role

description.description: A more detailed description of the custom role and what use it's intended for
description.example: Users with external-contributors role have limited access to most features in Unleash

type.description: [Custom root roles](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/rbac#custom-root-roles) (type=root-custom) are root roles with a custom set of permissions. [Custom project roles](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/rbac#custom-project-roles) (type=custom) contain a specific set of permissions for project resources.

permissions.description: A list of permissions assigned to this role

environment.description: The environments of the permission if the permission is environment specific

description.description: A more detailed description of the custom role and what use it's intended for

permissions.description: A list of permissions assigned to this role

environment.description: The environments of the permission if the permission is environment specific

paid.description: `true` if the invoice has been paid, `false` if it has not.

status.description: The current status of the invoice

invoiceURL.description: A URL pointing to where the invoice can be found.

invoicePDF.description: A link to a PDF-version of the invoice.

oidcSettingsSchema.description: Settings for configuring OpenID Connect as a login provider for Unleash

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable OpenID Connect for this instance

clientId.description: The OIDC client ID of this application.

secret.description: Shared secret from OpenID server. Used to authenticate login requests

autoCreate.description: Auto create users based on email addresses from login tokens

enableSingleSignOut.description: Support Single sign out when user clicks logout in Unleash. If `true` user is signed out of all OpenID Connect sessions against the clientId they may have active

defaultRootRole.description: [Default role](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/rbac#standard-roles) granted to users auto-created from email. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

emailDomains.description: Comma separated list of email domains that are automatically approved for an account in the server. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

acrValues.description:
Authentication Context Class Reference, used to request extra values in the acr claim returned from the server. If multiple values are required, they should be space separated. 
 Consult [the OIDC reference](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthorizationEndpoint) for more information

idTokenSigningAlgorithm.description: The signing algorithm used to sign our token. Refer to the [JWT signatures](https://jwt.io/introduction) documentation for more information.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/guides/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the OIDC token response to read which groups the user belongs to from.

addGroupsScope.description: When enabled Unleash will also request the 'groups' scope as part of the login request.

enablePkce.description: Enable PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) for enhanced security. Recommended for public clients and provides additional protection against authorization code interception attacks.

changeRequestDefaultChangeSchema.description:
A description of a default change that will be applied with the change request to prevent invalid states.

Default changes are changes that are applied in addition to explicit user-specified changes when a change request is applied. Any default changes are applied in the background and are not a real part of the change request.

action.description: The kind of action this is.

payload.description: The necessary data to perform this change.

id.description: This change requests's ID.

title.description: A title describing the change request's content.

environment.description: The environment in which the changes should be applied.

minApprovals.description: The minimum number of approvals required before this change request can be applied.

project.description: The project this change request belongs to.

features.description: The list of features and their changes that relate to this change request.

segments.description: The list of segments and their changes that relate to this change request.

approvals.description: A list of approvals that this change request has received.

rejections.description: A list of rejections that this change request has received.

comments.description: All comments that have been made on this change request.

createdBy.description: The user who created this change request.

imageUrl.description: The URL of the user's profile image.

createBannerSchema.description: Describes the properties required to create or update a banner.

message.description: The message to display to all users. Supports markdown.
message.example: **Reminder to everyone**: Maintenance is scheduled for *2337-12-27*.

enabled.description: Whether the banner should be displayed currently. If not specified, defaults to true.

variant.description: The variant of the banner. One of "info", "warning", "error", or "success". If not specified, defaults to "info".

sticky.description: Whether the banner should be sticky on the screen. If not specified, defaults to `false`.

icon.description: The icon to display on the banner. Can be one of https://fonts.google.com/icons. If not specified, this will be the default icon for the variant. If "none", no icon will be displayed.

link.description: The link to display on the banner. Can either be an absolute or a relative link (e.g. absolute: "https://example.com" or relative: "/admin/service-accounts"). If "dialog", will display a dialog when clicked. If not specified, no link will be displayed.

linkText.description: The text to display on the link. If not specified, will be displayed as "More info".

dialogTitle.description: The title to display on the dialog. If not specified, this will be the same as `linkText`.

dialog.description: The markdown to display on the dialog. If not specified, no dialog will be displayed.
dialog.example:
# Information

Maintenance is **scheduled**.

## More details

This is an example dialog that supports Markdown.

linkText.description: The text to display on the link. If not specified, will be displayed as "More info".

grouping.description: Whether the data is aggregated by month or by day.

period.description: The date of the data point. Formatted as a full date (e.g. 2023-04-01) if the data is aggregated by day or as a month (e.g. 2023-04) if the data is aggregated by month.

scimSettingsSchema.description: An object describing settings for SCIM provisioning.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is currently enabled.

hasToken.description: Whether a SCIM provisioning API token is currently set.

setScimSettingsSchema.description: An object describing settings for SCIM provisioning.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is currently enabled.

scimTokenSchema.description: An object describing a SCIM provisioning API token.

token.description: The token used for SCIM API authentication. Can be revoked at a later stage by generating a new one.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable SAML 2.0 for this instance

signOnUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign On

certificate.description: The X509 certificate used to validate requests

signOutUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign Out

spCertificate.description: Signing certificate for sign out requests

autoCreate.description: Should Unleash create users based on the emails coming back in the authentication reply from the SAML server

emailDomains.description: A comma separated list of email domains that Unleash will auto create user accounts for.

defaultRootRole.description: Assign this root role to auto created users

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/guides/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the SAML token response from which to read the groups the user belongs to.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable OpenID Connect for this instance

clientId.description: The OIDC client ID of this application.

secret.description: Shared secret from OpenID server. Used to authenticate login requests

autoCreate.description: Auto create users based on email addresses from login tokens

enableSingleSignOut.description: Support Single sign out when user clicks logout in Unleash. If `true` user is signed out of all OpenID Connect sessions against the clientId they may have active

defaultRootRole.description: [Default role](https://docs.getunleash.io/concepts/rbac#standard-roles) granted to users auto-created from email. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

emailDomains.description: Comma separated list of email domains that are automatically approved for an account in the server. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

acrValues.description:
Authentication Context Class Reference, used to request extra values in the acr claim returned from the server. If multiple values are required, they should be space separated. 
 Consult [the OIDC reference](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthorizationEndpoint) for more information

idTokenSigningAlgorithm.description: The signing algorithm used to sign our token. Refer to the [JWT signatures](https://jwt.io/introduction) documentation for more information.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/guides/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the OIDC token response to read which groups the user belongs to from.

addGroupsScope.description: When enabled Unleash will also request the 'groups' scope as part of the login request.

enablePkce.description: Enable PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) for enhanced security. Recommended for public clients and provides additional protection against authorization code interception attacks.

signalQueryResponseSchema.description: A list of signals that have been registered by the system

signalQuerySignalSchema.description: An object describing a signal enriched with source data.

id.description: The signal's ID. Signal IDs are incrementing integers. In other words, a more recently created signal will always have a higher ID than an older one.

payload.description: The payload of the signal.

createdAt.description: The date and time of when the signal was created.

source.description: The signal source type. Should be used along with `sourceId` to uniquely identify the resource that created this signal.

sourceId.description: The ID of the source that created this signal. Should be used along with `source` to uniquely identify the resource that created this signal.

tokenName.description: The name of the token used to register this signal.

sourceName.description: The name of the source that registered this signal.

sourceDescription.description: A more detailed description of the source that registered this signal.
sourceDescription.example: Notifies when CPU usage is over 90%.

edgeEndpointTrafficSchema.description: Represents traffic data for a single endpoint in Edge

identifier.description: The ID of the Edge process, typically a ULID. Newly generated for each restart of the instance.

appName.description: The name of the application, configured by the user, typically persistent across restarts of Edge.

region.description: Which region the Edge instance is running in. Set to AWS_REGION by default (if present).

edgeVersion.description: Which version (semver) of Edge is the Edge instance running.

started.description: RFC3339 timestamp for when the Edge instance was started.

connectedStreamingClients.description: How many streaming clients are connected to the Edge instance.

connectedEdges.description: A list of Edge instances connected to the Edge instance.

requestsSinceLastReport.description: Requests made to edge's endpoints since last report. Meant to be used for billing purposes.

connectionConsumptionSinceLastReport.description: Connection consumption data since last report, including features and metrics consumption. Used for long-lived backend SDKs with backend controlled number of instances.

requestConsumptionSinceLastReport.description: Request consumption data since last report, grouped by metered group. Used for frontend SDKs with unpredictable and potentially large number of user devices running those SDKs.

hosting.description: A marker that tells Unleash whether this Edge instance is self-hosted, enterprise self-hosted, or hosted by Unleash.

edgeInstanceTrafficSchema.description: Represents requests to the Edge instance (/api/client/features, /api/frontend, etc.)

accessDenied.description: A map containing requests that were denied.

cachedResponses.description: A map containing requests that had cached responses.

edgeLatencyMetricsSchema.description: Representing latency for an Edge operation.

avg.description: Average time per request in milliseconds.

p99.description: 99% of requests finished within this amount of milliseconds.

edgeProcessMetricsSchema.description: Represents Edge instance resource usage data.

cpuUsage.description: CPU usage, in seconds, since start of process.

/api/client/features.description: 20x and 30x requests to the client features endpoint

/api/proxy.description: Traffic to the proxy endpoint (proxy endpoint is deprecated, use /api/frontend instead)

/api/client/metrics/bulk.description: Traffic to Edge Metrics (from other Edge instances)

/api/client/metrics/edge.description: Traffic to Edge Metrics (from other Edge instances)

edgeUpstreamLatencySchema.description: Latencies for upstream actions from Edge (downloading/syncing new features, uploading metrics, uploading instance data)

features.description: Feature consumption data points

requests.description: Number of requests in this interval
Total number of requests for this metered group
